title: WW2 veteran and TikTok star ‘Papa’ Jake Larson dies aged 102
byline: Tributes are being paid to American World War Two veteran and social media star Jake Larson, known online as ‘Papa Jake’, who has died at the age of 102.

title: Officials say 85 Palestinians seeking aid are killed in Gaza as Israel widens evacuation orders
byline: Gaza saw its deadliest day yet for aid-seekers in over 21 months of war as at least 85 Palestinians were killed while trying to reach food on Sunday, the territory’s Health Ministry said.

title: Over 20 injured as buses collide in Galigamuwa
byline: Over 20 individuals have been injured and hospitalized following a head-on collision between a private bus and a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus in Galigamuwa, Kegalle, early this morning (21), police said.

title: Fairly heavy rains likely in parts of the island
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Japan’s PM vows to stay on despite bruising election loss
byline: Japan’s ruling coalition has lost its majority in the country’s upper house, but Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has said he has no plans to quit.

title: Indictments served against Mahindananda and Nalin Fernando in new case
byline: Former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando, both currently serving prison sentences, along with former Sports Ministry Secretary, retired Major General Nanda Mallawarachchi, who is also serving a prison sentence, have been indicted today (21) at the Colombo High Court.

title: Anunayake Thero of Asgiri Chapter passes away
byline: The Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Anamaduwe Dhammadassi Thero, has passed away at the age of 67.

title: Youth arrested with smuggled cigarettes at BIA
byline: An individual has been arrested at the at the arrival terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for smuggling a total of 10,000 sticks of foreign-made cigarettes (50 cartons).

title: Attempted shooting at Kollupitiya nightclub foiled?
byline: An attempted shooting at a nightclub in Kollupitiya was reportedly thwarted last night (19) when two individuals, arriving on a motorcycle, failed to execute their plan.

title: Eight hospitalized after suddenly collapsing at beauty salon in Kandy
byline: A group of individuals inside a beauty salon in a multi-story building on Peradeniya Road in Kandy has been hospitalized after suddenly fainting and collapsing on the floor.

title: 30 injured after car plows through crowd outside LA nightclub; driver pulled from vehicle and shot
byline: A vehicle rammed into a crowd of people waiting to enter a performance venue along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles early Saturday, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, authorities said.

title: Performer unfurls Palestinian flag on Royal Opera House stage
byline: A cast member at the Royal Opera House in London has unfurled a Palestinian flag on stage during the curtain call on Saturday night.

title: Suspect arrested with 2,828kg of smuggled dried ginger in Norochcholai
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of 2,828kg of dried ginger during a coordinated search operation by the Sri Lanka Navy and Police in Sanjeethawaththa, Norochcholai.

title: One dead, another injured in clash at Inamaluwa Teak Reserve in Sigiriya
byline: An individual has died while another has sustained injuries following a clash that broke out in a ‘wadiya’ where labourers were staying, within the Inamaluwa Teak Reserve in Sigiriya.

title: One spill gate of Upper Kotmale Reservoir opened due to heavy rain
byline: Steps have been taken to open one sluice gate of the Upper Kotmale Reservoir, due to heavy rainfall in the catchment areas of the reservoir.

title: Death toll rises to 14 in South Korea as heavy rain triggers landslide and flooding
byline: Two people have died and a further two were missing in the South Korean resort town of Gapyeong on Sunday, after a landslide engulfed houses and flooding swept away vehicles during a period of heavy rainfall.

title: Bus driver arrested for driving through closed railway crossing in Nawalapitiya
byline: The driver of a private bus who drove the bus through a railway crossing while the gate was closed due to an oncoming train in the Warakawa area of Nawalapitiya, has been arrested by the Nawalapitiya Police.

title: Dr. Nadeesha Chandrasena who won the 2025 WIPO Global Award returns to the island
byline: Sri Lankan engineer Dr. Nadeesha Chandrasena who won a 2025 WIPO Global Award in the environment category for her innovative stormwater management solution, the ‘Smart Drain’, returned to the island.

title: Trump signs new stablecoin regulations into law, a major milestone for crypto industry
byline: President Donald Trump on Friday signed into law new regulations for a type of cryptocurrency, a major milestone for an industry that has spent heavily to strengthen its legitimacy and political might.

title: Tsunami alert issued after powerful quakes strike off coast of Russia
byline: Three powerful earthquakes struck off the coast of Russia’s far east on Sunday, triggering a tsunami alert, the US Geological Survey said.

title: MP Jagath Vithana’s son remanded
byline: The son of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Member of Parliament Jagath Vithana, who was arrested by officers of the Panadura Walana Anti-Vice Unit yesterday, has been remanded.

title: 3 killed, 150 rescued after passenger ship catches fire in Indonesia
byline: At least three people were killed and about 150 others rescued after a passenger ship caught fire in the waters of Indonesia’s North Sulawesi province on Sunday, according to Veri Ariyanto, a senior official at the provincial Search and Rescue Office.

title: Ukraine seeks new round of talks with Russia
byline: Ukraine has proposed a new round of peace talks with Russia, President Volodymyr Zelensky has said, in a move aimed at restarting negotiations that halted last month.

title: US tech CEO resigns after Coldplay concert embrace goes viral
byline: A US tech company says its chief executive has quit after he was apparently caught on a big screen at a Coldplay concert embracing a female co-worker, in a clip that went viral.

title: 40% of police personnel suffering from non-communicable diseases: Acting IGP
byline: Around 40% of police personnel are suffering from non-communicable diseases, according to Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya.

title: Three including two infants die in tragic accident in Narammala
byline: A driver and two infants have died in an accident when a car, which the driver had lost control of, veered to the right side of the road and collided with a bus plying from the opposite direction in Narammala.

title: Saudi Arabia’s ‘Sleeping Prince’ dies after 20 years in coma
byline: Prince Al-Waleed bin Khaled bin Talal Al Saud, widely known as Saudi Arabia’s “Sleeping Prince,” has passed away at the age of 36 after spending nearly two decades in a coma.

title: Iranian national arrested at BIA while attempting to flee to Europe using forged British passport
byline: An Iranian national has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while attempting to illegally flee to Europe via Japan and Turkey using a forged British passport.

title: MP Jagath Vithana’s son to be produced before court
byline: The son of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Member of Parliament Jagath Vithana, who was arrested by officers of the Panadura Walana Anti-Vice Unit, is scheduled to be produced before court today.

title: Syria’s leader urges Bedouin tribes to commit to a ceasefire ending clashes with the Druze
byline: Syria’s interim President Ahmad al-Sharaa urged Sunni Muslim Bedouin tribes Saturday to “fully commit” to a ceasefire aimed at ending clashes with Druze-linked militias that left hundreds dead and threatened to unravel the country’s postwar transition.

title: Israeli forces kill 67 Palestinians seeking aid in northern Gaza, Hamas-run ministry says
byline: The Israeli military has killed at least 67 people waiting for UN aid lorries in northern Gaza, the territory’s Hamas-run health ministry says.

title: Govt plans to triple daily fresh milk procurement by 2029: Dy Minister
byline: The government is hoping to increase the amount of fresh milk collected from farmers to 3 million liters per day by 2029, up from 1 million liters in 2025, states Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock Namal Karunaratne.

title: Two missing after fishing boat caught in strong winds in seas off Chilaw
byline: Two fishermen along with a boat they set out from Chilaw are reported missing, with a major search and rescue operation underway.

title: Tourist arrivals in July top 98,000
byline: A total of 98,765 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in July, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Chinese national arrested with smuggled cigarettes in Kollupitiya
byline: A foreign national who was in possession of 600 sticks of foreign cigarettes, illegally smuggled into the country, has been arrested by the Kollupitiya Police.

title: Anti-immigrant rallies staged across Poland
byline: Anti‑immigration protests have taken place in dozens of towns and cities across Poland.

title: ‘Red’ warning for strong winds up to 60 kmph issued
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas in the areas extending from Puttalam to Pottuvil via Colombo, Galle, and Hambantota.

title: Philippines’ President to meet Donald Trump hoping to secure trade deal
byline: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr meets US President Donald Trump this week, hoping Manila’s status as a key Asian ally will secure a more favourable trade deal before an Aug 1 deadline.

title: Retired DIG Rohan Premaratne denies reports of Bribery officers visiting his residence
byline: Retired Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG) Rohan Premaratne has denied media reports that have claimed that officials of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) have visited his residence over ongoing investigations related to financial fraud.

title: Final rites of Most Ven. Anamaduwe Sri Dhammadassi Thero to be held on Thursday
byline: The final rites of the late Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect, Most Venerable Anamaduwe Sri Dhammadassi Thero is scheduled to take place with state sponsorship on Thursday (24).

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas in the areas extending from Chilaw to Mannar via Puttalam and from Galle to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

title: Sri Lanka to procure US West Texas Intermediate crude oil?
byline: The government is reportedly looking at the possibility of procuring US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil in a bid to reduce the trade deficit between Sri Lanka and the United States.

title: Alaska Airlines grounds all flights after IT outage disrupts systems
byline: U.S. carrier Alaska Airlines grounded all of its flights after experiencing an IT outage on Sunday that impacted its systems, the company said, without specifying the nature of the outage.

title: SLTB Bus-Tipper collision along Kandy-Colombo road leaves two injured
byline: A tipper truck has collided with a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus along the Kandy-Colombo main road in Weweldeniya injuring two individuals, police said.

title: One dead while another missing after drowning in Panahaduwa lake
byline: Two individuals who went fishing in the Panahaduwa lake in Udawalawa have drowned, police stated.

title: ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 70 points today.

title: Bangladesh Airforce F-7 aircraft crashes into school in Dhaka, at least 1 dead
byline: Bangladesh Airforce F7 aircraft crashed onto a school campus in Dhaka’s northern Uttara area on Monday (July 22) around 1:30 pm, according to the military and a fire official.

title: Hearing of a case against ex-Minister Udaya Gammanpila adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court has scheduled a date to recall the case filed by the Attorney General against former Minister Udaya Gammanpila, who is accused of misappropriating shares worth Rs. 20 million belonging to an Australian businessman by allegedly preparing a forged power of attorney.

title: State revenue up by nearly 20% in first five months of 2025
byline: The state revenue has surged to Rs. 1,942.36 billion during the first five months of 2025, marking a 19.95% increase in comparison to the figures from the same period last year, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Mumbai-bound Air India flight skids off runway during landing amid heavy rainfall
byline: An Air India flight flying in from Kochi had a close shave while landing in Mumbai this morning after it veered off the rain-soaked runway.

title: President and IMF delegation discuss next review of EFF
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and representatives of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) have held discussions regarding the future review of the Extended Fund Facility between the IMF and Sri Lanka.

title: Microsoft to help France showcase Paris’ Notre-Dame Cathedral in digital replica
byline: Microsoft is teaming up with the French government to create a digital replica of Paris’ Notre-Dame Cathedral, France’s most visited monument, the U.S. tech company’s president, Brad Smith, said on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka’s first 24-hour news channel ‘Ada Derana 24’ celebrates 11 years
byline: Ada Derana 24, Sri Lanka’s pioneering 24-hour news channel and a trusted local brand recognized for its international-standard journalism, proudly marks its 11th anniversary today.

title: ‘Superman’ flexes its might in second weekend with $57.3 million
byline: James Gunn’s “Superman” showed staying power in its second weekend at North American box offices, collecting $57.3 million in ticket sales and remaining the No. 1 movie in cinemas, according to studio estimates Sunday.

title: Colombo Archdiocese seeks prosecution of sacked former SIS chief
byline: While acknowledging the disciplinary action taken against former State Intelligence Service (SIS) chief, Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (SDIG) Nilantha Jayawardena as positive step...

title: Travel ban issued on MP Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter and son-in-law
byline: The Matugama Magistrate’s Court issued a travel ban on MP Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter and son-in-law, following a request by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam to be held on August 10
byline: The 2025 Grade Five Scholarship Examination is scheduled to be held on August 10, 2025.

title: “One in every ten adults in Sri Lanka affected by kidney disease”: SLMA
byline: One in every ten adults in the country is affected by kidney disease, according to the Sri Lanka Medical Association.

title: At least 19 killed as Bangladesh air force plane crashes into college campus
byline: At least 19 people were killed as a Bangladesh air force training aircraft crashed into a college and school campus in the capital city of Dhaka on Monday, a fire services official said.

title: Over 1,200 persons nabbed during special police operation
byline: A total of 1,241 individuals have been arrested during a special island-wide operation carried out in connection with offenses related to illicit liquor and narcotics.

title: Body of Uni student who drowned while trying to save her boyfriend found
byline: The body of a young woman who went missing after drowning while trying to save her boyfriend has been found in the Viyana canal near the 17th post of the Mahiyanganaya Police Division.

title: Japan faces rice shortage as South Korea battles oversupply
byline: Japan is grappling with rice shortages and price hikes, forcing it to ramp up imports.

title: Ex-Sports Ministry Secretary Nanda Mallawarachchi files petition before Appeals Court
byline: The Court of Appeal today (21) ordered that a petition filed by former Secretary of the Ministry of Sports retired Major General Nanda Mallawarachchi, be taken up for consideration on July 28.

title: Harvard heads to court to argue Trump administration’s $2.6bn cuts were illegal
byline: Harvard University will appear in federal court Monday to make the case that the Trump administration illegally cut $2.6bn from the storied college – a pivotal moment in its battle against the federal government.

title: India’s Vice President Dhankar resigns citing health concerns
byline: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post on Monday, citing health concerns and the need to prioritise medical care. The resignation, addressed to President Droupadi Murmu, is effective immediately and has been made under Article 67(a) of the Constitution.

title: One person injured in shooting in Seeduwa
byline: An individual has been injured following a shooting incident in the Rajapakshapura area in Seeduwa this evening (21), police said.
